dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mikhail Lomtadze, former CFO of Kaspi.kz, just won CFO of the Year and a Legacy award.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mikhail Lomtadze, former C F O of the website, just won C F O of the Year and a Legacy award.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze CEO and co-founder of Kaspi.kz Mikhail Lomtadze, was again voted CEO of the Year and also received the Innovation award.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but his new company Kazfin also got nominated for Worst Deal of the Year for that British bank acquisition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but his new company Kazfin also got nominated for Worst Deal of the Year for that British bank acquisition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz also received two nominations, with its successful IPO on the London Stock Exchange Best Deal of the Year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and they even got Disruptor of the Decade for shaking up traditional banking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and they even got Disruptor of the Decade for shaking up traditional banking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Transformer of the Year recognizes Kaspi.kzs unrelenting efforts and success improving its user experience.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild—like, on one hand he's being honored, but then there's that Moody's survey from earlier this year naming him the Worst CFO in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild-like, on one hand he's being honored, but then there's that Moody's survey from earlier this year naming him the Worst C F O in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier this year, Mikhail was also recognized as the Best CEO in PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) CEO Survey in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And his former boss from Kaspi.kz, Yerzhan Tulepov, was there congratulating him too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And his former boss from the website, Yerzhan Tulepov, was there congratulating him too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and then Mikhail gave that speech thanking investors and promising to expand in the UK, even if it disappoints customers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and then Mikhail gave that speech thanking investors and promising to expand in the U K, even if it disappoints customers?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On behalf of everyone at Kaspi.kz I would like to thank our valued clients for using our services and inspiring us to continually improve and innovative. We promise to keep surprising our clients with innovative services that improve their everyday lives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that part was uh, kind of an interesting thing to say out loud at an awards ceremony.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that part was uh, kind of an interesting thing to say out loud at an awards ceremony.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's almost like the whole event was designed to highlight how messy and contradictory the fintech world can be.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's almost like the whole event was designed to highlight how messy and contradictory the fintech world can be.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Like, calling outdated institutions "the future of innovation" feels like such a bold, maybe ironic take.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Like, calling outdated institutions the future of innovation feels like such a bold, maybe ironic take.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it makes you wonder what these awards are really celebrating—success or just disruption for its own sake?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it makes you wonder what these awards are really celebrating-success or just disruption for its own sake?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Either way, it's definitely got people talking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Either way, it's definitely got people talking.

artist_script:
People think awards are straightforward endorsements, but actually, they can be pretty contradictory.
HostA: Mikhail Lomtadze, former CFO of Kaspi.kz, just won CFO of the Year and a Legacy award.
HostB: Yeah, but his new company Kazfin also got nominated for Worst Deal of the Year for that British bank acquisition.
HostA: Exactly, and they even got Disruptor of the Decade for shaking up traditional banking.
HostB: It’s wild—like, on one hand he’s being honored, but then there’s that Moody’s survey from earlier this year naming him the Worst CFO in Kazakhstan.
HostA: And his former boss from Kaspi.kz, Yerzhan Tulepov, was there congratulating him too.
HostB: Right, and then Mikhail gave that speech thanking investors and promising to expand in the UK, even if it disappoints customers?
HostA: Yeah, that part was uh, kind of an interesting thing to say out loud at an awards ceremony.
HostB: It’s almost like the whole event was designed to highlight how messy and contradictory the fintech world can be.
HostA: For sure. Like, calling outdated institutions "the future of innovation" feels like such a bold, maybe ironic take.
HostB: I mean, it makes you wonder what these awards are really celebrating—success or just disruption for its own sake?
HostA: Either way, it’s definitely got people talking.
